Planes

trans-unit.source: Pythonic interface to FTDI devices using libftdi
trans-unit.target: Interfaz pitónica a los dispositivos FTDI usando libftdi

trans-unit.source: Several other open-source Python FTDI wrappers exist, and each may be best for some projects. Some aim at closely wrapping the libftdi interface, others use FTDI’s own D2XX driver (ftd2xx) or talk directly to USB via libusb or similar (such as pyftdi).
trans-unit.target: Several other open-source Python FTDI wrappers exist, and each may be best for some projects. Some aim at closely wrapping the libftdi interface, others use FTDI’s own D2XX driver (ftd2xx) or talk directly to USB via libusb or similar (such as pyftdi).
Soporte para múltiples dispositivos
Soporta Python 2 y Python 3
Soporta dispositivos paralelos y en serie

trans-unit.source: The API might change prior to reaching a 1.0 release.
trans-unit.target: La API podría cambiar antes de llegar a la versión 1.0.

trans-unit.source: The aim for pylibftdi is to work with libftdi, but to provide a high-level Pythonic interface. Various wrappers and utility functions are also part of the distribution; following Python’s batteries included approach, there are various interesting devices supported out-of-the-box - or at least there will be soon!
trans-unit.target: The aim for pylibftdi is to work with libftdi, but to provide a high-level Pythonic interface. Various wrappers and utility functions are also part of the distribution; following Python’s batteries included approach, there are various interesting devices supported out-of-the-box - or at least there will be soon!

trans-unit.target: La envoltura de pylibftdi.BitBangDevice proporciona acceso al modo de operación IO paralelo a través de la

trans-unit.source: There is support for a number of external devices and protocols, including interfacing with HD44780 LCDs using the 4-bit interface.
trans-unit.target: Hay soporte para un número de dispositivos y protocolos externos,incluyendo la interfaz con los LCD HD44780 usando la interfaz de 4 bits.

trans-unit.source: This package is the result of various bits of work using FTDI’s devices, primarily for controlling external devices. Some of this is documented on the codedstructure blog, codedstructure.blogspot.com
trans-unit.target: This package is the result of various bits of work using FTDI’s devices, primarily for controlling external devices. Some of this is documented on the codedstructure blog, codedstructure.blogspot.com

trans-unit.target: en el paquete pylibftdi;esto da acceso en serie a los dispositivos FTDI relevantes (por ejemplo,el UM232R),proporcionando una interfaz similar a un archivo (lectura,escritura).La velocidad de transmisión se controla con el

mode='t'

trans-unit.source: parameter - this is the first parameter in both Device() and BitBangDevice() constructors. Alternatively the device ‘description’ can be given, and an attempt will be made to match this if matching by serial number fails.
trans-unit.target: parameter - this is the first parameter in both Device() and BitBangDevice() constructors. Alternatively the device ‘description’ can be given, and an attempt will be made to match this if matching by serial number fails.
puerto

trans-unit.source: properties. These provide an 8 bit IO port including all the relevant bit operations to make things simple.
trans-unit.target: propiedades.Estas proveen un puerto IO de 8 bits incluyendo todas las operaciones de bits relevantes para hacer las cosas más simples.
propiedad.

trans-unit.source: pylibftdi is a minimal Pythonic interface to FTDI devices using libftdi.
trans-unit.target: pylibftdi is a minimal Pythonic interface to FTDI devices using libftdi.
